solution: 1916B - Two DivisorsFirst case: $$$b \mod a = 0$$$.In this case, $$$b = a \cdot p$$$, where $$$p$$$ is the smallest prime factor of $$$x$$$. Then $$$x = b \cdot p = b \cdot \frac{b}{a}$$$.Second case: $$$b \mod a \neq 0$$$.In this case, $$$b = \frac{x}{p}, a = \frac{x}{q}$$$, where $$$p, q$$$ are the two smallest prime factors of $$$x$$$. Then $$$\gcd(a, b) = \frac{x}{p \cdot q}, x = b \cdot p = b \cdot \frac{a}{\gcd(a, b)}$$$.author: sadness, developer: marzipan
